DOC.brief_summary: This is a randomized controlled trial of telemonitoring vs usual care provided by home care agencies for atients with HF. The study hypothesis is that Telemonitoring will reduce hospital re-admission rates, urgent care visits, unscheduled physician appointments, ER visits in patients with heart failure over the 60 day post hospitalization period.
DOC.brief_title: A Trial of Telemonitoring in Adults With Heart Failure
DOC.criteria: HF (primary or secondary) diagnosis regardless of ejection fraction (EF) and NYHA class II IV at the time of HHC admission and HHC services initiated following a hospital stay inability to stand on a scale, weight over 500 lbs, unable to hear and/or see, or no working land line phone in the residence. Additional exclusion criteria were: patients with severe ischemic heart disease, MI and/or CABG in the last 6 weeks, severe uncorrected valvular disease, home inotropic therapy, severe lung disease (oxygen dependent), active cancer, uncorrected thyroid disease, AIDS, or end stage renal disease on dialysis.
